channel.title: 525 j5connect?
channel.description: Ok so I have my loader and Class68_sub20_sub15 IPs set to local host. I have exceptions set on my firewall (I tried disabling it too just incase), my no-ip is also set up. There's only two things that I can think of, A) It's because the computer I'm trying to connect to the server is on the same network or B) The router because I'm at a friends and don't have the pass to it and it's setup. Thanks :)

item.title: 525 j5connect?
item.dc:creator: @Asphyxia Asphyxia
item.description:
@Asphyxia wrote:

Finally, I got it! The exception I set in Windows firewall don’t save for some reason? So I just have to go in and make sure the rules are still there when I run the server.

Read full topic

item.title: 525 j5connect?
item.dc:creator: @dy3p8ntrkid dy3p8ntrkid
item.description:
@dy3p8ntrkid wrote:

If you are connecting via router, make sure the ports are forwarded correctly with your IPv4 # correct (use /ipconfig in cmd prompt to find it) also make sure on your firewall it is allowing the connections 43594-43594 TCP through.

Read full topic

item.title: 525 j5connect?
item.dc:creator: @Asphyxia Asphyxia
item.description:
@Asphyxia wrote:

Okay well I managed to get into the router and forward the ports. After that it loaded right away but then it would say “error connecting to server” when I would try to login. Now its back to being stuck on “connecting to update server” however the j5connect takes like 2 or 3 minutes before it comes up. Gahhh any ideas?

Read full topic

item.title: 525 j5connect?
item.dc:creator: @Shadowspkin Shadowspkin
item.description:
@Shadowspkin wrote:

Well if your connectiong VIA Local host then you shouldent have to setup a no-ip. And all… And this are the problems. A) The client is not connecting to the server or B) The server is not really on.

Make sure you changed the Loader.java and client.java…

Read full topic
